adjective.description: Bursting with activity; full of intense excitement.
Bursting with flame, light, or colour.
Flaring or spread out, expanded, unfurled.

adverb.description: In or into a state of intense excitement or activity.
So as to burst with flame, light, or colour.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Mackay (1812–1889), poet and writer. From a- + flare.
